examples.title:
Card‑based
  wizard surfaces each data stream (Web & App Activity, YouTube
  History, Ad Personalization) with binary toggles and inline explanations.
  Progress bar guides the user through four steps
examples.use_case:
Ecosystems
  aggregating cross‑product data needing central control over collection &
  use.
examples.why_selected:
Shows
  progressive‑disclosure, checklist pattern that scales across products and
  devices.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Recognition
  rather than recall; Flexibility & efficiency

examples.title:
Overlay
  wizard with five sequential modules (Posts, Profile, Apps, Ad Preferences,
  Face Recognition). Visual meter and plain‑language tips.
examples.use_case:
Social
  networks with complex, legacy settings spread across menus.
examples.why_selected:
Demonstrates
  task‑focused segmentation, reducing cognitive load while meeting GDPR Art.
  25.
examples.pbd_alignment:
Privacy
  embedded, Respect for user privacy
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Aesthetic
  & minimalist design; User control & freedom

examples.title:
Web
  portal lists telemetry categories (Location, Search, Browsing, Voice) plus
  delete/export buttons and ad‑settings toggles. Provides visual data‑usage
  timeline.
examples.use_case:
Cloud/OS
  vendor balancing telemetry with user agency.
examples.why_selected:
Combines
  data‑view, delete, export, and advertising settings in a single authenticated
  portal.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Visibility
  of system status; Help users recognize, diagnose, recover
